prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples, "Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here  "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Find genes specific for each "group" in my annotation data  using statistical tests. Plot PCA only using "group" specific genes and color code PCA by "group" variable in my annotation data.

here are first few lines of the file(s).

Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx:
Genes	CASE_1	CASE_2	CASE_3	CASE_4	CASE_5	CASE_6	CTRL_1	CTRL_2	CTRL_3	CTRL_4	CTRL_5	CTRL_6
TSPAN6	9832	25521	23529	0	32	0	10558	20573	6507	0	0	 0
TNMD	3281	 7167	 3435	0	 0	0	  202	  403	 203	0	0	21


SRP021193.colData.tsv:
diagnosis	group	LibrarySelection
CASE_1	non-ischemic cardiomyopathy	CASE	cDNA


response:
```
# Load required libraries
library(readxl)
library(data.table)
library(limma)
library(ggplot2)
library(RColorBrewer)

# Read count table
count_table <- read_excel("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx")

# Remove the first column (gene names)
count_table <- count_table[, -1]

# Read annotation data
annotation <- fread("SRP021193.colData.tsv", sep = "\t")

# Match the rows of annotation with the columns of count table
annotation <- annotation[match(colnames(count_table), annotation$diagnosis), ]

# Define groups based on "group" column in annotation data
groups <- unique(annotation$group)

# Perform statistical tests for each group
results <- list()
for (group in groups) {
  # Subset count table using samples from the specific group
  group_samples <- annotation$diagnosis[which(annotation$group == group)]
  group_counts <- count_table[, group_samples]

  # Perform statistical test (e.g. t-test) for each gene
  test_results <- rowttests(group_counts)

  # Store significant genes for the group based on p-value threshold (e.g. 0.05)
  significant_genes <- rownames(test_results)[test_results$adj.P.Val < 0.05]

  # Store the significant genes for the group in the results list
  results[[group]] <- significant_genes
}

# Get the group-specific genes
group_specific_genes <- unique(unlist(results))

# Subset count table to include only the group-specific genes
group_specific_counts <- count_table[group_specific_genes, ]

# Perform PCA using group-specific genes
pca <- prcomp(t(group_specific_counts))

# Get the group labels for color coding
group_labels <- annotation$group[match(colnames(group_specific_counts), annotation$diagnosis)]

# Plot PCA with color-coded groups
pca_plot <- ggplot(data.frame(pca$x), aes(x = PC1, y = PC2, color = group_labels)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(color = "Group")
pca_plot
